All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
Appointment
The Appointment class represents an appointment model with various fields.
AppointmentDBAccess
This class provides access to the appointment data in the database.
Contact
The Contact class represents a basic contact model, Used to retrieve name and email address.
ContactDBAccess
A class provides methods to access and retrieve information about contacts from a database.
Country
The Country class represents a country model with its fields.
CountryDBAccess
A class provides methods to access and retrieve information about countries from a database.
Customer
The Customer class represents a customer model with its various fields Used to retrieve customer information using its getters and setters
CustomerDBAccess
A class that provides database access methods for managing customer data.
DialogBox
The DialogBox class provides utility methods for displaying different types of dialog boxes using JavaFX Alert dialogs, such as confirmation dialogs, error, and prompt dialogs.
EditAppointmentController
This class is responsible for editing of appointments.
EditCustomerController
The EditCustomerController class implements the Initializable interface and is responsible for controlling the user interface for editing customer information.
FirstLevelDivision
The FirstLevelDivision class represents a first-level division within a country.
FirstLevelDivisionDBAccess
This class provides methods for accessing and retrieving data related to first-level divisions.
JDBC
The JDBC class provides utilities for managing a JDBC connection to a MySQL database.
LoginController
The LoginController class handles user login and authentication in the application.
Main
The Main class serves as the entry point for the Appointment Scheduler application.
MainScreenController
The MainScreenController class is responsible for controlling the main application screen.
ReportsController
The ReportsController class is responsible for displaying reports related to contacts, appointments, and divisions.
User
The User class represents a user model with its fields.
UserDBAccess
The UserDBAccess class provides methods for accessing user data in a database.
ViewAppointmentController
The ViewAppointmentController class is responsible for displaying details of a selected appointment and providing options to edit or cancel the appointment.
ViewCustomerController
This class, ViewCustomerController, is responsible for managing the customer details view and handling user interactions within the view.
